author: @kristofferloistantano7801
text:
WOW. Okay that was just WOW. More than WOW, actually. 

I wanna write a letter for Carats, so I hope y'all meme experts take time and read this even if it might get long and emotional: 

I've said this before and I'll say it again, Seventeen never ever fails to impress. By just looking and listening at their new releases so far, from Change Up to this, they definitely deserve to be called as versatile artists. First they introduce us with Change Up through the leaders, and might I say it was a perfect introduction for what we Carats are really in for. For three weeks after that, they've been giving us masterpiece after masterpiece (and this does not even diminish how wonderful their previous releases are like daaaaayyuuummmm "Well" is still a personal fave). And what's great is that each song from each unit defines their group perfectly. Personal and emotional lyric-writing expressed in powerful raps and vocals? The Hiphop unit delivered! Complex yet more than pleasing choreography backed with a unique music, the Performance unit delivered! And now, a wonderful melody sang by five voices each having their own unique vocal color, the Vocal unit delivered! I'll say it all the time because I will never regret stanning Seventeen. We carats are so lucky to have them. As we all know they've been working nonstop. Other Pledis artists wore Hanboks for their Chuseok greetings, but they greeted in their prince costumes because they're still not done with the concert. I honestly didn't even think they'd have another comeback for this year. I thought the World Tour was their last major event for this year, but no, they'd release their second full-length album soon. They've been working really hard and as we'd seen their vlives, they never fail to mention how they are doing all this for us. I think Seventeen really wants to make Carats feel that this year is 20SVT. And this year isn't over yet, but I am more than satisfied already. I hope we all continue to support them and also, I love this fandom so much. Seventeen was the first Kpop group I seriously got in and poured my heart into to be part of it's fandom for a long time (right after Super Junior and wow that was a long time ago). I haven't been a carat for too long, only a little over a year, so I've never been there for them from the start, but wow I feel like I know every one of them now because they are all just so lovely. And I'm also very happy that the fandom I first truly belonged in was one that delights in peace, or at least tries to avoid extreme situations that are in no way beneficial to Seventeen at all. But despite all this, I know we are not a perfect fandom either. We get pressed, we get triggered too. But I really thank y'all because a fandom is really, really a big factor for me when stanning a group. And so far, I've been really contented with us. And I really really really hope that we could continue to be like this. Okay yes I might have said a lot. I'm sorry but y'all! Seventeen is pure talent! My wig has been snatched for the fourth time now! A proud fanboy has done talking. Thanks for your time! Have a good day.

PS Who's ready for November I actually am prepared but in no way am I ready am i making any sense asdjdjfhsjajjdd

author: @anitacamacho4001
text: Since I haven't seen anything regarding this yet I'll say it. LEE JIHOON IS A GENIUS!! This song is beautiful, emotional, soothing, but most importantly impactful! Woozi has such a way to make songs so unique. Woozi deserves an award! His work and dedication is so admirable. Woozi of course always feels the burden but when he takes all that burden and combines it with the amount of wisdom in his mind... Guys its powerful. I instantly started crying when I heard him sing. He may be the shortest but he has so much strength, both physically and mentally. I only hope so much for him and his career. I can already imagine him walking away with a grammy. He is a bundle of pure talent. I hope he knows that. This masterpiece should be treasured. It comes from the hands of a true king.

author: @jamie-vm6dr
text:
"but still, don't cry
even though it will be hard
i will be there for you"
this song is delicately poised but it's so powerful at the the same time? i especially really really love the "no matter how much time it takes, come back to me" and that they would wait endlessly for it. quite akin to the hiphop unit's Trauma, this song feels like it's showcasing each member's different yet similar story. and vocal unit has succeeded in changing their concept every time, from 20 to 물래 듣지 마요, to 입버롯 to Pinwheel now. their songs are usually heartbreaking, but this felt like something else. it felt like nostalgia and hope. thank you seventeen, you never fail to amaze me.

author: @paopaomae
text: What if...the teasers that the boys put out in May took place in the present perspective? Most of them ended or started in black and white, so what if that was taken in the “past” point of view and Pinwheel takes place before the AL1 era? (It is 0.5 Chapter, after all). Perhaps Joshua was trying to reach out to Hoshi (but Jun heard his message instead), Woozi got lost, but still had Vernon’s compass, Mingyu’s piano is now Woozi’s (?), and when DK looks into the puddle, it connects to Joshua’s al1 teaser when he looks into the puddle too...When Seungkwan is in the car, what if he was trying to get to someone but got lost instead...Perhaps all of them were looking for one another (thus the running is present in both teasers and videos) But they had to go through struggles and different paths before finding each other? Like notice how they’re each alone in the beginning but they find one another towards the end...

author: @paopaomae
text: Despite only getting into kpop this summer, I am so happy to have stanned SEVENTEEN as my first kpop group. The music and videos they put out are seriously masterpieces. The lyrics, composition, LITERALLY EVERYTHING...I am in love. I’ve been attached to western music for so long but kpop has given me a whole different perspective. Music truly breaks every boundary, even language. As the DWC era comes to a close, I hope that the new one will be full of energy and we carats will always support the boys!

author: @hissoka
text:
Jeonghan has grown so much as a vocalist and my heart swells so much when he sings. I'm so proud of him. 

Joshua's voice is so refreshing and heart breaking at the same time. It's a talent to have emotion in your voice when singing and he has so much talent. 

Seungkwan's acting has improved too. His visuals are also out of this world.

Seokmin is so talented, I can't even. His voice, his visuals, his acting (Hoshi would be proud because DK is 10:10)

LEE JIHOON- the glue of our seventeen. I'm so proud of him. He has so much on his shoulders, but he never disappoints his members or his fans. This song is so well produced, composed and the music video itself is so amazing. I hope Jihoon looks back at his awards, his members and his fans and knows in his heart that this is all because of him. I'm so proud of him, and everyone in svt.
